purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 隶)
Pictophonetic: 隶 indicates the sound; 柰 (bear) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
隸屬 [ lì shǔ ]: to belong to (a category); to be attached to
隸書 [ lì shū ]: clerical script; official script (Chinese calligraphic style)

heisig_chinese_memo: The bondservant takes care of the annoying work like making a new broom from a tree.  The butler then takes care of easy stuff like sweeping the altar.
Ru_trainchinese: lì: (сущ/глаг) человек в подчинении; принадлежать, подчиняться; стиль каллиграфии
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The most common servant of the bondservant is shoveling snowflakes off of his master's long driveway.
humanum_full_description_en:
The original meaning of " li " is slave. "Lichen" in bronze is the name of the criminals and slaves serving sentences in Qin. The male is called the official and the female is called the concubine. Gao Nuhe Shiquan: "Gong Li Chen Mou". Tang Huilin's "All Classics Sounds and Meanings" Volume 6: ""Kao Sheng": "Li, low subordinates, servants." "Shuowen": "Li, attached to the censer. From the official, the sound. 𨾀, the seal script From the ancient style." He Linyi believes that " li " is also the sound symbol of " li ".

" Li " can mean a sinner. "Zhou Li‧Qiu Guan‧Si Li": "The method of holding the five officials, distinguishing their objects and holding their government orders." Zheng Xuan's note: "The five officials are called the criminal officials, and the four diaries are also the officials."

" Li " also means a humble person. Han Bangu's "Study on Han Ying Peng Lu Wu Chuan": "The letter (Han Xin) is only hungry, and the cloth (English cloth) is a real tattoo."

" Li " also means a minister, that is, a minister of low rank. "Selected Works of Sima Xiangru (Shanglin Fu)": "The land can be reclaimed, and it is known as the rural suburbs, so it can be used as a sprout." Guo Pu quoted Sima Biao as saying: "Li, also a small minister.

" Li " can be used as a verb to mean to act. "Xunzi·Yibing": "The merits and rewards of each other, the top five and the top five families." Yang Yan's note: "If you get the top five, you will serve the five families in the village."

" Li " also refers to subsidiary. "The Book of the Later Han·Feng Yizhuan": "He Po Handan is a part of the generals, each of whom has a lieutenant." Li Xian's note: "Lie, belong."

" Li " can also refer to official script, a type of Chinese character font. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liuxie's "Wen Xin Diao Long-Lian Zi": "It was Li Si who deleted Xie and Qin Zhuanxing, Cheng Miao created the official script and the ancient text was abandoned." For the origin of the official script, refer to the Northern Wei Dynasty Li Daoyuan's "Water Scripture · Valley Water" : "...The ancient official script originated in the Qin Dynasty, but the seal characters are complex, and there is no drama, so the province of the official person is used as the official script." See also Tang Zhang Huai's "Book Break": "The official script, Qin It is also written by Cheng Miao, a native of Xiajun. The character Yuancen was originally a county official, who offended Shihuang, and he was in Yunyang prison. Tan Si was ten years old, and he was written in the official script with a radius of Yixiaozhuan. Three thousand characters were played. ．Used as the imperial history. It’s a lot of trouble with memorials, and it is difficult to make seal characters. Instead, the official characters are used. I think the official script is the official script."
humanum_short_description_en: The word " li " starts from " li ", "柰" sound, the original meaning is slave.
humanum_full_description:
「隸」的本義是奴隸，金文「隸臣」是秦國服刑的罪犯、奴僕的名稱，男的稱隸臣，女的稱隸妾。高奴禾石權：「工隸臣牟」。唐慧琳《一切經音義》卷六：「《考聲》：『隸，賤屬也，僕也。』」《說文》：「隸，附箸也。从隶，柰聲。𨾀，篆文隸从古文之體。」何琳儀認為「隶」也是「隸」的聲符。

　　「隸」可表示罪人。《周禮‧秋官‧司隸》：「掌五隸之法，辨其物而掌其政令。」 鄭玄注：「五隸，謂罪隸，四翟之隸也。」

　　「隸」也表示身份卑微的人。漢班固《述韓英彭盧吳傳》：「信(韓信)惟餓隸，布(英布)實黥徒。」

　　「隸」還表示小臣，即等級不高的臣子。《文選‧司馬相如〈上林賦〉》：「地可墾闢，悉為農郊，以贍萌隸。」郭璞注引司馬彪曰：「隸，小臣也。」

　　「隸」可用作動詞，表示役使。《荀子‧議兵》：「功賞相長也，五甲首而隸五家。」楊倞注：「獲得五甲首，則役隸鄉里之五家也。」

　　「隸」還指附屬。《後漢書‧馮异傳》：「及破邯鄲，乃更部分諸將，各有配隸。」 李賢注：「隸，屬也。」

　　「隸」亦可指隸書，漢字字體的一種。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧練字》：「乃李斯刪籀而秦篆興，程邈造隸而古文廢。」關於隸書的起源，參北魏酈道元《水經注‧穀水》： 「……古隸之書， 起于秦代， 而篆字文繁， 無會劇務， 故用隸人之省， 謂之隸書。」又見唐張懷瓘《書斷》：「按隸書者，秦下邽人程邈所作也。邈字元岑，始為縣吏，得罪始皇，幽系雲陽獄中。覃思十年，益小篆方圓而為隸書，三千字，奏之。始皇善之．用為御史。以奏事煩多，篆字難成，乃用隸字。以為隸人佐書，故曰隸書。」

    • 隶 [ lì ] subservient; servant

  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 柰 [ nài ] crab-apple tree; to endure, to bear
    • 隶 [ lì ] subservient; servant
①附屬，屬於：隸屬。配隸(從屬)。直隸中央。
②封建時代的衙役：隸卒。皁隸。徒隸。
③舊社會中地位低被奴役的人：奴隸。隸僕。
④漢字的一種書體：隸書。隸字。漢隸。

隸書 [ lì shū ]: clerical script; official script (Chinese calligraphic style)

Chinese: The bondservant takes care of the annoying work like making a new broom from a tree. The butler then takes care of easy stuff like sweeping the altar.
Meaning: bondservant
Hanzi: 隶
Story: The most common servant of the bondservant is shoveling snowflakes off of his master's long driveway.
Kind: traditional

「 隸 」的本義是奴隸，金文「隸臣」是秦國服刑的罪犯、奴僕的名稱，男的稱隸臣，女的稱隸妾。高奴禾石權：「工隸臣牟」。唐慧琳《一切經音義》卷六：「《考聲》：『隸，賤屬也，僕也。』」《說文》：「隸，附箸也。从隶，柰聲。𨾀，篆文隸从古文之體。」何琳儀認為「 隶 」也是「 隸 」的聲符。 「 隸 」可表示罪人。《周禮‧秋官‧司隸》：「掌五隸之法，辨其物而掌其政令。」 鄭玄注：「五隸，謂罪隸，四翟之隸也。」 「 隸 」也表示身份卑微的人。漢班固《述韓英彭盧吳傳》：「信(韓信)惟餓隸，布(英布)實黥徒。」 「 隸 」還表示小臣，即等級不高的臣子。《文選‧司馬相如〈上林賦〉》：「地可墾闢，悉為農郊，以贍萌隸。」郭璞注引司馬彪曰：「隸，小臣也。」 「 隸 」可用作動詞，表示役使。《荀子‧議兵》：「功賞相長也，五甲首而隸五家。」楊倞注：「獲得五甲首，則役隸鄉里之五家也。」 「 隸 」還指附屬。《後漢書‧馮异傳》：「及破邯鄲，乃更部分諸將，各有配隸。」 李賢注：「隸，屬也。」 「 隸 」亦可指隸書，漢字字體的一種。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧練字》：「乃李斯刪籀而秦篆興，程邈造隸而古文廢。」關於隸書的起源，參北魏酈道元《水經注‧穀水》： 「……古隸之書， 起于秦代， 而篆字文繁， 無會劇務， 故用隸人之省， 謂之隸書。」又見唐張懷瓘《書斷》：「按隸書者，秦下邽人程邈所作也。邈字元岑，始為縣吏，得罪始皇，幽系雲陽獄中。覃思十年，益小篆方圓而為隸書，三千字，奏之。始皇善之．用為御史。以奏事煩多，篆字難成，乃用隸字。以為隸人佐書，故曰隸書。」

Gao Nuhe Shiquan: "Gong Li Chen Mou". Tang Huilin's "All Classics Sounds and Meanings" Volume 6: ""Kao Sheng": "Li, low subordinates, servants." "Shuowen": "Li, attached to the censer. From the official, the sound. 𨾀, the seal script From the ancient style." He Linyi believes that " li" is also the sound symbol of " li". " Li" can mean a sinner. "Zhou Li‧Qiu Guan‧Si Li": "The method of holding the five officials, distinguishing their objects and holding their government orders." Zheng Xuan's note: "The five officials are called the criminal officials, and the four diaries are also the officials." " Li" also means a humble person. Han Bangu's "Study on Han Ying Peng Lu Wu Chuan": "The letter (Han Xin) is only hungry, and the cloth (English cloth) is a real tattoo." " Li" also means a minister, that is, a minister of low rank. "Selected Works of Sima Xiangru (Shanglin Fu)": "The land can be reclaimed, and it is known as the rural suburbs, so it can be used as a sprout." It’s a lot of trouble with memorials, and it is difficult to make seal characters. Instead, the official characters are used. I think the official script is the official script."

隸字的基本解释

隸
lì

隸
dài
均见“隶”。

隸字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lì］
［《廣韻》郎計切，去霽，來。］
“隶2”的繁体字。亦作“隷1”。亦作“1”。亦作“1”。亦作“1”。
(1)奴隶；奴仆。
(2)特指奴隶中的一个等级。
(3)罪人。
(4)指低贱的人。
(5)小臣；下臣。
(6)贱。参见“隸臣”。
(7)役使。
(8)指役事。
(9)差役。
(10)附属；隶属。
(11)追随；跟随。
(12)汉字字体的一种。即隶书。
(13)通“肄”。查阅；考察。
(14)通“肄”。研习；研究。
(15)姓。古有史官隶首。见汉张衡《西京赋》。

隸字的康熙字典解释

【戌集中】【隶字部】　隸； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1363第30
【唐韻】【集韻】?郞計切，音麗。【說文】附著也。【後漢·馮異傳】部分諸將，各有配隸。【註】隸，屬也。又【孔融傳】皆隸名而已。　又【史記·酷吏傳】關東吏隸郡國出入關者。【註】隸，閱也。　又【廣韻】僕隸。【集韻】賤稱也。【左傳·隱五年】皁隸之事。【註】士臣皁，皁臣輿，輿臣隸。又【桓二年】士有隸子弟。【註】士?，自以其子弟爲僕隸。【周禮·夏官·方相氏】帥百隸而時儺。【儀禮·旣夕】隸人涅厠。【註】隸人，罪人也。今之徒役作者也。【晉語】其猶隸農也。【註】隸，今之徒也。　又官名。【周禮·夏官】隸僕掌五寢之掃除糞洒之事。又【秋官】司隸掌五隸之灋：罪隸、蠻隸、閩隸、夷隸、貉隸。又【前漢·百官公卿表】司隸校尉周官。　又【後漢·律曆志】隸首作數。【註】博物記曰：隸首，黃帝之臣。一說隸首，善算者也。　又【正字通】姓也。漢隸延之。　又隸書。【晉書·衞恆傳】秦旣用篆，奏事繁多，篆字難成，卽令隸人佐書，曰隸字，漢因行之。隸書者，篆之捷也。○按隸書，諸說不一。或云秦後旴陽變

隸字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
隸字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
scribe
lì
scribe
dài
See "li" for both.
scribe
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lì］
["Guang Yun" Lang Ji cut, go to Ji, come. ]
The traditional characters of "Li 2". Also known as "Li 1". Also known as "1". Also known as "1". Also known as "1".
(1) Slave; slave.
(2) Specifically refers to a class of slaves.
(3) Sinner.
(4) Refers to a lowly person.
(5) Small ministers; subordinates.
(6) Cheap. See "Lichen".
(7) Servants.
(8) Refers to service.
(9) The escort.
(10) Attachment; affiliation.
(11) Follow; follow.
(12) A type of Chinese font. That is the official script.
(13) Through "肄". Check; check.
(14) Through "肄". Study; research.
(15) Last name. In ancient times, there were official historians under the head. See Han Zhang Heng's "Xijing Fu".
scribe
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【戌集】【Li Zi Department】　 Li; Kangxi Strokes: 17; Page Number: Page 1363 Page 30
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun]? Yan Ji cut, Yin Li. [Said the text] Attachment too. [Hou Han·Feng Yi Biography] Some generals have their own officials. [Note] Subordinate, subordinate. Also [Kong Rong Biography] are all official names.　[Historical Records·Cool Officials' Biography] People who enter and exit the Guandong official county. [Note] Li, Yue Ye.　[Guang Yun] Pu Li. [Jiyun] It's also called cheap. [Zuo Zhuan·Hidden Five Years] The Zaoli incident. [Note] Shichenzao, Zaochenyu, Yuchenli. Also [Huan Ernian] Shi has Li children. [Note] Shi?, since his children are servants. [Zhou Li·Xiaguan·Fang Xiangshi] Shuai Baili and then Nuo. [Rituals·Xi Xi] Liren Nirvana. [Note] Liren, as well as sinners. The author of today's apprenticeship is also. [Jin dialect] It is still under the jurisdiction of agriculture. [Note] Li, also the disciples of today.　Also official name.
